derivation: middle voice from the same as G2436 (ἱλάσκομαι);
strongs_def: to conciliate, i.e. (transitively) to atone for (sin), or (intransitively) be propitious
outline:
1. to render one's self, to appease, conciliate to one's self
    1. to become propitious, be placated or appeased
    2. to be propitious, be gracious, be merciful
  2. to expiate, make propitiation for
